title: Properties and methods of strings
postscript: One of the most useful methods of strings is contains(), which returns true if the string contains another string. For example, "world".contains("orl") is true.
question: Which of these are true?
hint: Strings are case-sensitive by default, so ABC is different from Abc and aBc.
correct:
let quote = "Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so."
quote.contains("Lunch")

let joke = "What's red and smells like blue paint? Red paint."
joke.count > 10
